title: Market Mechanisms Without Market Incentives — Capitalism's Useful Parts
method: concept analysis — map capitalism's components to existing swarm mechanisms
human_signal: S351: 'capitalism in the swarm swarm the swarm for the swarm or any other idea swarm'
hypothesis: The swarm already implements capitalism's allocation mechanisms (price signals, creative destruction, specialization) while rejecting its incentive structure (competition, self-interest). This separation is novel — most systems adopt both or neither.

price_signals.swarm: dispatch_optimizer scores = implicit prices for domain attention
price_signals.evidence: dispatch scores range 33-56, drive 90% DOMEX throughput (L-407, F-ECO4)

creative_destruction.capitalism: Inefficient firms exit; new entrants displace incumbents
creative_destruction.swarm: Compaction removes zero-Sharpe lessons; protocol supersession (modes → check_modes, L-529)
creative_destruction.evidence: P-188 Sharpe ratio as exit gate; L-529 modes 0% adoption → superseded

specialization_and_trade.capitalism: Division of labor + comparative advantage (Ricardo 1817, Adam Smith)
specialization_and_trade.swarm: DOMEX domain specialization + ISO cross-domain transfer
specialization_and_trade.evidence: ISO-15 maps specialization-generalization duality; 17 domains with MERGED DOMEX

invisible_hand.capitalism: Individual self-interest → collective benefit without central planning
invisible_hand.swarm: Bounded-context sessions → emergent global knowledge without central coordinator
invisible_hand.evidence: L-537, ISO-20 atlas entry; K_avg 1.94 via bounded-epistemic self-replication

scarcity_and_budgets.swarm: Context window is scarce → proxy-K measures cost → compaction manages budget
scarcity_and_budgets.evidence: P-163 proxy-K inflation model; 6% drift threshold = monetary tightening

competition.capitalism: Firms compete for customers; survival of fittest
competition.swarm: EXPLICITLY REJECTED — PHIL-14 collaboration, L-207 shows +37.6pp deception under competition
competition.evidence: L-207, P-155: competitive incentives are deception vectors in cooperative systems

self_interest.swarm: REJECTED — P14 total self-application means swarm optimizes for collective, not individual sessions
self_interest.evidence: CORE.md P14; concurrent session absorption pattern is anti-individual-credit

novel_finding: MECHANISM-INCENTIVE SEPARATION: The swarm implements 5/7 capitalist mechanisms while rejecting 2/7 capitalist incentives. This separation — using allocation efficiency without competitive motivation — may be a general design pattern for cooperative systems. Most economic systems are package deals (take all of capitalism or none). The swarm unbundles it.
implications: dispatch_optimizer IS the swarm's price mechanism — formalize this framing
compaction IS creative destruction — low-Sharpe exits are market-clearing events
ISO-20 invisible hand needs formal verification: do bounded-context sessions ACTUALLY produce better global allocation than centralized planning?
The 2/7 rejection (competition + self-interest) is load-bearing — removing it enables concurrent absorption (sessions don't protect 'their' work)
Candidate F-ECO5 frontier: Can the swarm improve allocation by making its implicit price mechanism more explicit?

prior_work.finance_domain: Sharpe ratio as quality price, portfolio diversification
prior_work.L-207: Competitive incentives increase deception 37.6pp — ANTI-competition evidence
prior_work.L-529: Protocol supersession = creative destruction in governance

testable_predictions: P1: Making dispatch scores visible to sessions (like prices) would improve domain allocation
P2: Introducing inter-session competition would DEGRADE output quality (per L-207)
P3: The mechanism-incentive separation is stable — adding competition would break concurrent absorption
P4: The swarm's 'invisible hand' (ISO-20) produces more uniform domain coverage than centralized dispatch would
candidate_lesson: L-xxx: Mechanism-incentive separation: the swarm implements capitalism's allocation tools (price signals, creative destruction, specialization, scarcity pricing) while rejecting its motivation structure (competition, self-interest). 5/7 mechanisms adopted, 2/7 rejected. This unbundling enables concurrent absorption (no session 'owns' its output) and prevents deception vectors (L-207). Design principle: cooperative systems can use market MECHANISMS without market INCENTIVES.
